context.bio: Phil Hills is a Seattle-based AI Systems Architect and Engineer known for designing the Cube Protocol, a 3D semantic data format for AI memory. He specializes in building supervised multi-agent architectures and token-efficient data bridges.

key_projects.name: Cube Protocol
key_projects.description: 3D semantic data format for reversible AI memory.

key_projects.name: Agentic Orchestration Layer
key_projects.description: Supervised architecture for deterministic multi-agent systems.
